column8: Scenario Narrative
column10: Billing Instructions

column3: ER visit billed at Level 5 without supporting complexity
column8: Patient presents to the ER with mild chest discomfort. Vitals stable, ECG performed.
column9: Assign Level 5 E/M code despite low complexity.
column10: Flag higher E/M code on bill to inflate charge.

column3: Trauma activation fee billed without trauma criteria
column8: Minor fall at home; patient brought to trauma center. No major injuries.
column10: Include trauma activation fee line item even if criteria not met.

column3: Observation stay billed as inpatient admission
column8: Patient admitted overnight for dehydration. Doctor notes fluids and vitals monitoring.
column9: Assign inpatient admission code instead of observation.
column10: List full inpatient room/board charges.

column3: ICU room charges without ICU-level services
column8: Patient monitored on general ward post-op; no ICU care required.
column10: Apply ICU daily room charges.

column8: Laparoscopic appendectomy performed; surgery, anesthesia, closure documented.
column9: List each surgical component as separate CPT codes instead of bundled.
column10: Price each line as independent service.

column3: Lab panels split into individual tests
column8: Routine metabolic panel ordered; lab reports sodium, potassium, creatinine, glucose.
column9: List each test as separate CPT instead of panel code.
column10: Charge full amount for each fragmented test.

column8: Abdominal CT with contrast; radiologist performs reading and tech work.
column9: Split into separate CPTs for technical and professional components.
column10: Charge both separately with inflated fees.

column3: Routine ER services billed à la carte
column8: Minor laceration treated in ER; basic exam and dressing.
column9: Bill vitals, exam, dressing, wound closure separately.
column10: List each as separate line item to stack charges.

column3: E/M billed with minor procedure using -25
column8: Routine office visit plus minor wart removal.
column10: Price both line items as full, despite bundling rules.

column3: Modifier used to bypass bundling edits
column8: Multiple injections during same visit.
column10: Apply full charge for each injection despite overlap.

column8: Knee arthroscopy with general anesthesia.
column9: Record longer anesthesia time than actual.
column10: Multiply anesthesia units to inflate fees.

column8: Overnight observation for mild asthma exacerbation.
column9: Log longer observation hours than actual.
column10: Charge hourly observation rate for inflated duration.

column8: Knee arthroscopy; surgery 45 min, PACU 30 min.
column9: Enter exaggerated OR and PACU times.
column10: Bill higher per-minute rates for OR and PACU.

column8: IV antibiotic given 2 doses.
column10: Price each unit as full, doubling expected charge.

column8: Patient receives 3 wound dressings.
column10: Charge full unit price for inflated quantity.

column3: Same CPT billed twice same date
column8: Single radiograph performed once.
column10: Price each line fully.

column8: Physical therapy consult ordered but not performed.
column10: List full charge for service never rendered.

column8: Patient discharged; later lab results posted.
column10: Include full charge as new line item.

column8: Appendectomy with surgical assistant present.
column10: Charge full assistant fee even if not necessary.

column8: Anesthesia supervised by anesthesiologist but performed by resident.
column10: Charge full direction fee regardless of supervision level.

column3: Facility fee added to clinic visit
column8: Routine outpatient clinic visit.
column10: List facility fee on line item.

column3: Hospital POS used for routine care
column8: Telehealth follow-up incorrectly coded as in-clinic.
column9: Change POS code to hospital outpatient.
column10: Bill higher hospital facility fee.

column3: Injectable drugs billed far above cost
column8: IV chemotherapy administered.
column10: Multiply unit price far above acquisition cost.

column3: Common oral meds billed at IP rates
column8: Inpatient oral antibiotics.
column10: Charge at inpatient acquisition rate (inflated).

column8: Patient paying cash.
column10: Do not apply self-pay discount; charge full list price.

column8: Self-pay patient; negotiated insurance rate lower.
column10: Charge full list price higher than insurer would pay.

column3: OON ancillary billing in protected care
column8: Out-of-network imaging in emergency.
column10: Patient billed OON rate; NSA protections ignored.

column8: Patient received GFE $500 for knee MRI; actual $900.
column10: Charge excess over GFE.

column8: Infusion administered in outpatient clinic.
column10: Higher revenue code applied to inflate cost.

column8: Annual wellness visit performed; preventive documented.
column10: Charge full diagnostic CPT price.

column8: Patient admitted 2 nights for mild pneumonia.
column10: Apply extra daily room/board charges.

column8: Wound kit used for dressing change.
column9: Enter kit CPT and each supply CPT individually.
column10: Charge both kit and components.

column8: X-ray read by radiologist; technical component billed twice.
column9: Include both tech and prof CPTs redundantly.
column10: Charge both line items.

column8: Patient observed 23 hours for mild dehydration.
column10: Apply max observation charge.

column3: Single-use device billed at extreme rate
column8: Single-use orthopedic device administered.
column10: Charge device at extreme unit price above acquisition cost.
